properties.title: Maven Build Number Plugin Changes Report
properties.author: Julian Wood

release.action: Add support for Mercurial
provide scm branch identifier in pom for finer-grained build differentiation
Upgrade to last scm svnjava provider (to upgrade to SVNkit 1.3.0 in order to support svn 1.6)
1.0-beta-3 on maven central has a transitive dependency that cannot be resolved in maven central.
The name of the BuildMojo class should be changed to match the goal name.
add a parameter to change scm implementation.
Reuse maven scm api to get svn info.
Remove tagBase configuration.
Skip scm update when maven run in offline mode.
Retrieve revision number using xml format, which should make it work on international systems.
Add an independent timestamp property, but don't give it a format - it's just number of ms since the epoch.
You can configure the names by which the buildnumber and timestamp are retrieved.
We now let commandline params such as -Dmaven.buildNumber.doCheck=false take precedent over the config.
Decoupled the buildnumber from a particular phase. Must now be specified.
Update dependencies to released versions.
Change the interaction with the commandline, demanded by new dependencies.
Invert the skipUpdate and the skipCheck commands to doUpdate and doCheck, to faciliate release.
Added ability to use a timestamp or a sequential build number.
Made some additions to the pom so that the snapshot dependencies can be downloaded automatically.
First release of the plugin.
